headline.main: The Gallant Life of the Chinook Salmon; RETURN TO THE RIVER. A Story of the Chinook Run. By Roderick L. Haig-Brown. Illus- trated by Charles DeFeo. 248 pp. New York: William Mor- row & Co. $3.

lead_paragraph: THERE is gallantry in sacri- fice for an ideal. When such sacrifice is made by a rea- soning human we term it heroism, but when performed by an unreasoning fish we pass it off lightly under the heading of instinct.
snippet: THERE is gallantry in sacri- fice for an ideal. When such sacrifice is made by a rea- soning human we term it heroism, but when performed by an unreasoning fish we pass it off lightly under the heading of instinct....
